description: I really wanted to love this app. It has one of the most beautiful looks but it kept crashing and even worse deleted my todo's and notes which I've stored on a local nextcloud server. (Flatpak version on Fedora KDE 31).
I love this app - it helps me to get my things done without difficulty.

While it hasn't got all the bells and whistles, eg sharing notes, this is the best replacement for Google Keep I've found so far. Connected to WebDav on a local NextCloud server, it syncs across KDE desktop and Android much better than any of the NextCloud dedicated apps I've tried.
it crashes after installation but after restarting computer, the app was working just fine.
I am using OpenTodoList for a few months now (iOS and Linux) and it works fine. I have not experienced any crashes.
Neben klassischen Aufgabenlisten kann ich auch wiederkehrende Aufgaben sehr einfach erstellen, das Tool hilft mir gerade enorm Überblick über zahllose asynchrone Vorlesungen zu behalten.
summary: Einfache, intuitive Bedienung und alle Funktionen, die ich brauche

description:
La imagen se ve interesante (en la tienda) pero nunca arrancó....
Tengo Xubuntu en una x64 con 4 Gb a 2.2 Ghz... 
Saludos.
summary: No arranca en Xubuntu... habrá que indagar porqué..

description: Tienes las funciones necessarias y funciona correctamente junto con la cuenta nextcloud
Unless it does and I missed it, a notes app without a system tray icon is not that useful to me. But the nextcloud sync is interesting.

it looked like what i wanted, but wouldn't run after a very lengthy installation (like 25 minutes?). i tried to launch in console so i could see what it was up to and got the following:


You can do this with those commands:
snap install kde-frameworks-5-core18
snap refresh kde-frameworks-5-core18
snap connect opentodolist:kde-frameworks-5-plug kde-frameworks-5-core18:kde-frameworks-5-core18-slot

Looks like a nice application. But maybe there should be an advisory about the KDE dependencies.
